p: Haemoconcentration was reached in the 33% of dogs. Considering the VBGA and biochemistry results, the number of dogs showing extra‐range values (T0‐T1) were respectively: hyponatremia (10‐23), hypernatremia (13‐17), hypokalemia (18‐30), hyperkalemia (10‐10), hypocloremia (46‐61), increased BUN (26‐34), increased sCr (3‐8). Fourty‐one dogs experienced cardiac death, 12 during hospitalization, the remaining dogs between 3 and 721 days after admission.
